I am trying to type slower softer and idk the keys are just freaking loud I feel like im gonna get in trouble cause everybody can hear my typing. maybe it just feels that way cause im in front of the keyboard and I can't really hear other people typing all that loud but man compared to the previous macbook keyboard (I had a MacBook Air and it has the same keyboard as the previous MacBook Pro) this keyboard is LOUD.
67.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

68.author: Katie
68.review_title: Great, reliable choice for the Macbooks!
68.review: Thank you Best Buy for offering such an amazing deal on the MacBook Pro (got mine for $999 compared to $1249 at the Apple Store). I was looking for a good laptop for school and wanted to have one that was compatible with my iPhone so I chose the Macbook Pro because it was recently updated. Only cons of this product would be that you have to be wary of what you do around it because of the butterfly keys, which makes it easier to have crumbs slip in and that you MUST buy a USB C to USB converter to connect things like a flash drive. Also with a case on the Macbook Pro can get dusty.
68.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

69.author: Angel
69.review: I bought this version of the Macbook Pro solely to edit photos in the desktop version of Lightroom Classic CC on the go. Mainly for the Retina Display. I was a bit hesitant because of the basic specs, but I knew it would probably do just fine for my needs. And boy, does it deliver. Not only is it the perfect portable size, but it packs the perfect amount of power to run Lightroom from import to export without missing a beat. I don't notice any difference from my way better spec'd out PC. Like I said, the most in going to push it is casual photo editing. I don't edit video or anything more demanding. I couldn't be any more happy with this purchase. Hope this helps!
69.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

70.author: CLOUDSONEXPRESS
70.review_title: Awesome Apple laptop! not that their was any doubt
70.review: Apple is such a well rounded and trusted brand. I already have a iMac which I use for music making and video editing so when I purchased the MacBook Pro for my wife so she could edit on the go, we were not let down as the transition from desktop to laptop seemed minimal. The MacBook Pro is just as powerful and fast as the iMac, and even handles multitasking without slowing down other programs. The battery life is good the sound is incredible. My only complaint besides no USB, is that memory storage can go fast, as you would expect for a laptop, however thats why their are external hard drives. In all if this is a computer your are looking into for editing or creating music by all means pick this up.
70.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

71.author: YogaTheBear
71.review: Build quality is astounding. Only two USB-C has been no big deal. Incredible speakers. Yes, the 128GB is slower than the larger Macbook Pro SSDs, but I really haven't noticed. Screen is colorful, clear, bright, and causes no eye strain. With the deep optimization between the hardware and Mac OS, it has plenty of power. I've been editing 4K GoPro footage in iMovie with no problems at all. Stays cool and quiet except when it renders, just gets little warm and the fan comes on lightly for a minute, impressive for a dual core. Got it for $1175 on sale and feel like I got a lot for the money. Can't say all Macbook Pros are a good deal, but this one certainly is.
71.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

72.author: alanp
72.review: Love my MacBook Pro. It’s true that you have to be mindful of sticking keys but apple put an extended warranty on them so you should be fine. I don’t eat or drink around my computer anyway so I don’t have to worry about crumbs. Treat your stuff well and you should be fine. The computer itself is fast and a dream to use. The keys have short key travel but are satisfying to type on. You should try it before buying to make sure it’s somethinf you’re ok with though. Also the track pad is just excellent.
72.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

73.author: Phil
73.review:
Battery life: 6-8 hours of continuous use (watching videos will make it shorter). It was a lot shorter before I updated the software.

Touchpad: larger than previous edition 

Keyboard: Keys are larger and are flatter than previous editions. To me, it sounds louder when typing compared to previous keyboard. 

Don't have the touchbar so I can't speak about that. 

Speakers are decently loud. 

Does not have USB or HDMI port so you will need to buy an adapter. 

Very lightweight. 

Does not come with extension cord for charger so you will have to buy that too if you need it.
73.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

74.author: Dhamerin
74.review: I absolutely love this laptop whether it is for work, school, or anything else. It gets the job done and then some. I recommend it to people who especially love Apple and already have an iPhone because it will sync with text messaging, iCloud, photos, and everything! I bought this for school but find myself using it every single day for leisure as well. This is the baseline model of the MacBook Pro, but I didn't find the need for an upgrade simply based on a touch bar. Faster processor is a different story though. If you don't need anything bigger or more powerful, look no further. They're already expensive enough.
74.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

75.author: notsohappycamper
75.review:
my true love i will never go back to windows
The good, its got an amazing screen on it. The weight is much nicer than the macbook air and i love the color!
The bad.. you will need a hefty bank account. You will need to buy adapters for any kind of usb ended plug you use which to me isnt the end of the world. Any apple product out there has lately been requiring an adapter of some sort. 
Mine I needed usb c to usb and I needed usb c to lightning and I needed badly the extra extension cord because these models dont come with the extra long cable. Otherwise I am very happy!
75.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

76.author: Andrew
76.review: The computer is great, lots of processing power for what I need it for which is general browsing/streaming, school work etc. The only thing missing that I found odd which is typical of Apple products is that there is no USB ports, only laptop charging ports and a headphone jack. Interesting to include a headphone jack on the newest MacBook when Apple has done away with the jack set up and moved towards the iPhone jack for headphones instead. Either way, still a great computer, but wish it had USB ports and a port for the lighting cable.
76.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

77.author: kspw
77.review: I purchased my 13" Macbook Pro mainly for editing images in Lightroom and Photoshop. I bought the bottom of the line model and was nervous that it wouldn't have the processing power that these programs demand. So far this computer has been able to do all that I've wanted it to and more. I also love that the battery life is long lasting. The only downside I can think of is the hard drive is small, but I bought a 500GB SanDisk Extreme Portable SSD external drive (highly recommended) to take care of my storage needs.
77.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

78.author: Jungsab
78.review_title: Best value as a long term investment
78.review:
After spending quite a time reviewing the premium laptops both Windows and Apple, I finally decided to buy this MacBook Pro and I am quite happy with the purchase.
1) Durable, MacBook lasts for minimum of 5 years much longer than Windows based laptops.
2) Safe compared to Windows, no virus issues.
3) Sleek, light, good battery with the standard premium laptops configuration
4) Serves well to my needs. I need this to remote login my office, with web-browsing.
5) Portable very light, I can slip in my leather file holder.

Overall I am very happy with this purchase.
78.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

79.author: Missjudy17
79.review: Nothing beats a MacBook Pro when it come to a laptop. I had to replace my old 2010 version which had a DC/DVD drive. I can't say I miss that part of it but the older version was more solid and seemed more sturdy. The connection plug is shorter and it doesn't light up to indicate that it is plugged in like the older version. Some other changes on this latest version is taking me some time to get used to. I really miss that the Apple logo on the outside of the laptop doesn't light up when it's opened. I don't know why they took way that feature. Maybe to extend battery life. Overall, it's still a great laptop and it's a MacBook Pro after all.
79.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

80.author: Ryan
80.review:
Just like my 1.5 year old iMac, this is a beautiful device. Very solid and well made with flawless operation. It's screen is so high quality that I haven't thought even once that the screen is only 13.3". Battery life is great.
The keyboard is really different - while the keys are almost completely flat, the very even tactile/mechanical feel sounds and feels very good and so easy to type with because of the limited travel/height.
So all-around GREAT purchase. Like a MacBook Air on MEGA-Steroids not a bad thing at all!
80.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

81.author: jubei747
81.review: This is my first Mac although I have been using iOS products since the gen 1 iPhone. I don't know why I waited so long to convert (the price, I guess?). I love how seamlessly it syncs with my iPhone with the handoff feature, which has made work much easier in so many ways. This Pro model runs very quickly and I'm repeatedly amazed at how gorgeous the display is. The only gripe I've had so far is the learning curve with learning a new OS. It's coming slowly, however, and I've got loads of Mac friends who are patiently helping me make the transition. :)
81.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

82.author: bate3
82.review: Within a month, I have started to experience overheating and when i thought it was getting out of hand, I contacted Apple. I thought the issue was resolved for a good 12 hours until this morning my laptop froze when started up and just shut off. Apple Support said it is an internal issue and now I have to bring it in and am currently without laptop. I'm super stressed and hate that I trusted in Apple and Best Buy to sell me a product that has only caused me problems and stress!
82.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

83.author: pyrcyvyl
83.review:
The 13" MacBook Pro has been exactly what I needed. It's lightweight, attractive, fast, intuitive, and flexible. I added a larger monitor at home so that I can sit back to read and my only complaint is the need for an adapter between the USB-C and every single type of monitor input there is (though previous apple models all required an adapter as well, so there's that). 
But, I would buy it again in a heartbeat and Best Buy price matched the computer to less than my university's educational promo price, so when I bought it again, I'd but it through Best Buy as well.
83.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

84.author: Ethan
84.review_title: Great Computer; big step up from 2012 MBP
84.review: This computer was a great buy. I did not opt for the touch bar mac as it was not something that I was planning on using. The touch bar has too layers of buttons to just do the simple task of adjusting brightness. I also love that Bestbuy price matches. Adorama was selling the 2017 13" MBP for cheaper, and bestbuy just matched it. Great buy. I am loving the computer so far. No problem. However, I would recommend getting a case for it. The computer is so thin, it needs something extra so that you actually grab it.
84.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

85.author: SmartyMarty
85.review: As someone who grew up with Windows, I have always avoided Apple PC products - until the iPad came out. The slick iOS which always worked everytime you went to do something (without the annoying Updating WIndows' you learn to accept) convinced me that maybe I should look at the MacBook for our daughters school work. She originally wanted the Macbook Air but we learned the reason it was so cheap was because it was becoming obsolete. The new MacBook doesn't disappoint. Great screen, great functionality and great price (when it is on sale) - but hurry as Best Buy is constantly changing the sale price.
85.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

86.author: Brett
86.review: A simple to use computer so those who aren't as "technologically inclined" it is easy to use and understand while still possessing a lot of extensive capability for those who need it. Retina display looks beautiful and I was not a fan of the Touch Bar so I chose this model since it doesn't have it. Yes it is more expensive than the windows laptops with similar specs but you'll get your moneys worth. Has such a premium look and feel to it and will last forever if you take care of it.
86.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

87.author: jomoss
87.review: I absolutely hate the fingerprints that you can get on the screen! I also thought it would be a bit faster than this, but I guess not. I had a HP Pavilion Intel Core 7th Gen i5 before this, so it was a massive change. It hurts to type for a long period of time, and it gets annoying because your elbows will pop. I'm a current Microbiology major, and it fits my needs just fine. Battery life is more than what I expected. Not sure if I would switch to a MBA, but I am considering it.
87.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

88.author: Briana
88.review: I purchased this in September of 2017 and in October of 2017 the screen cracked. I know this is my fault, but we all know that Apple products have a tendency to be sensitive and easy to break. There was a bobby pin in the hinge where you close the screen down to close the laptop and the screen cracked. I did not put a lot of force into closing it either. I feel for all the money I paid for this machine it should take less money to break the screen.
88.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

89.author: KP2018
89.review: We purchased the Apple MacBook Pro with a 13 inch display for our son to take to college his freshman year. He has found the computer easy to use and has indicated that it works “good” and is light to carry to class. Unfortunately even though our student package was to include the Best Buy virus protection, the Best Buy sales rep did not provide the promised virus protection. Therefore we had to use an alternative family virus package which does working properly on this Mac.
89.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

90.author: Victoria
90.review:
Love this laptop. It loads quickly, even with several programs running, and has an amazing keyboard (peep the new butterfly mechanism keys). The touchpad is also great and very responsive. For someone who has been wanting a MacBook Pro for several years, I am glad I waited until 2017 to purchase this particular model because it is fantastic.

As a side note, I worried about the Thunderbolt ports being annoying since most chargers/flash drives/other plug ins have not updated to utilize USB-C/Thunderbolt. However, it is not a problem and the thin design, speed, and power of each USB-C port make it worth losing other ports.
90.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

91.author: Jvand678
91.review:
As the title says, this is my 6th Mac purchase so needless to say I drink the koolaid. The machine is sleek, liggtweight, fast, and has wonderful battery life. If you're coming from a PC, try to avoid judging this machine based on the specs. Mac components work faster with macOS than a similarly built windows machine.

Complaints: I can't stand the fact that this gen Apple used this style of USB. You will have to buy all new cables and/or an adapter to use any other types of cables. Other than that, I'd highly recommend the machine.
91.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

92.author: skwarren
92.review: I have had HP computers my entire life. I finally made the switch to this computer because my HP had its last straw and I’m in nursing school so not having a computer was not an option for me. I can honestly say this is definitely worth the money! It gives me everything I need and more. It took me a few days to get used to it since I had always used an HP but after I did I was like a queen of all things Mac. I will never buy another non Apple computer again.
92.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

93.author: CalmDownItsWhatYouPaid4
93.review: I was skeptical whether I should switch from windows to Mac and I know everyone has their preference but I love mine so far! Especially since I can go into my local store and get help when I need it. The silver is super cute but I also like the sleekness of the space gray color as well. The 13” screen is plenty big for me and I’m a college student. I feel like the 15” would be a bit too big for my liking especially since I take it with me to and from school. Don’t forget the AppleCare+! If you’re going to spend $1200+ on a product might as well protect your investment
93.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

94.author: Lin1988
94.review:
This is my first Apple computer so I don't have much to say apart from the fact that, just as I fell in love with iPhones, I'm never going back to a PC. I purchased this mainly for video editing but because of its portability and other attractive features it's my preferred device for most other things as well. I store large-sized files in an external hard drive, plug in to work with them, and have not had any issues so far. 

Please note that this computer has a Micro C type USB port, which means that an adaptor is needed in order to plug in standard USBs.
94.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

95.author: chrispy83
95.review: There is no comparison to the MacBook Pro. It's lightning fast, battery life is super long, retina display screen is clearer than real life, internal speakers are loud, recessed keyboard makes typing effortless, and it's OS is intuitive. Most of my work on the computer is done via Internet usage, so I don't need a whole lot of space. I don't play games, I don't edit photos. If I did any of those things I may need a laptop with larger space, and the other MacBooks that do that are just too expensive. This guy, though, was around $1200 new, which is right in line with my budget. I do not regret this purchase!
95.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

96.author: Bret
96.review: I bought the MacBook Pro to try something different and because I am already in the Apple ecosystem. I love it! The laptop is nice and light and portable enough to store in a backpack. I would definitely recommend this one to college students because it is all you really need (unless you need more storage or a faster processor). I bought this one because the touchbar wasn’t worth the extra money and it looked kind of gimmicky to me. The only con I have is the fact that I had to buy a dongle to connect my usb devices to it. Other than that, the MacBook just works.
96.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

97.author: TheDeadmanSaloon
97.review: I purchased this item to replace a ThinkPad PC that I’ve been using for several years. This is actually the second MacBook Pro I’ve purchased as I purchased one several years ago for my wife. This is my first MacBook so it is taking me some time to learn the setup and the differences in a Apple vs a PC. I haven’t had any issues with the setup or using it. I purchased it shortly after Black Friday and it went on sale and BB refunded the difference in the price no questions asked. Just gave them the order number. Would definitely buy from BB and this product again without hesitation.
97.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

98.author: Drew
98.review_title: Go with the Touchbar model or wait until 2019
98.review: I upgraded to this from the 2015 Macbook Pro and I knew what I was getting into. The only problem with this model is that it wasn't refreshed in 2018 (unlike the upgraded 13" model with the Touchbar). Having used a family member's new 2018 Touchbar model, I found that it's 50% faster when running heavier applications due to the quad-core 8th gen. processor. If you can afford to wait, I would probably skip this model or pony up for the 2018 refreshed model.
98.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

99.author: katy
99.review: I went from a very old white heavy macbook to this and all I can say is wow! I bought this for pretty basic use...nothing fancy but the speed and processing power so far is excellent. Battery life is great. Super light, great sound...I cant complain! Apple always delivers! Only thing a little different is the new ports-so had to buy a conversion attachment so USB could be attached...but was already used to that from them doing it with iphone. Great service with bestbuy in store and associate and price was $200 off when I bought!
99.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

100.author: Sherlock
100.review:
I love Apple products, and this MacBook is no exception. It's nice and light, portable, thin, and has all of the power of the previous MacBooks. Only downside is that there are only USB-C connectors, which means you have to also purchase an adapter if you want to connect an "old school" (aka normal) USB to your laptop; also there are only 2 openings for those connectors, so use them wisely :)
Overall, I'm still very pleased with the product.
100.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

101.author: phxmoni
101.review: Although I have other Apple products (iPhone, watch, iPads, etc), this is my first Apple computer...and I love it! I never considered getting one because of the cost, but so far it seems like it's worth the investment. I'm not a techie kind of person, so specs don't really mean much to me. It just needed to be lightweight, fast, user friendly and reliable. So far, all of those conditions have been met - and then some. Battery life is great, I also love the fact that I can get text messages and I can FaceTime straight from my MacBook Pro!
101.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

102.author: keeks
102.review: I ended up returning this and purchasing a Surface instead and I'm so much happier. The Mac I feel like is cool and streamlined but the Surface is so much more user friendly and more fun to use and just easier to work with. I have an iPhone and ipad that I use a lot so I was excited to have something where everything was very compatible but that wasn't even the case. It is easier syncing my other apple stuff to the surface than it was to the MacBook which is so strange to me.
102.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

103.author: Steve
103.review:
The screen is amazing, and the speakers are the best out there. The lack of ports does not bother me and is evened out by how fast the computer charges! The battery life is about 9 hrs with normal usage, 5 hrs with video streaming, I am not sure about intense applications like final cut and gaming because I do neither. Charges in about an hr and half. OVERALL I love this MacBook. Looks amazing. It is fast. period. Best Buy is doing great stocking these! 
IF you see a negative review, remember there are negative reviews for everything. But this computer rocks.
103.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

104.author: Collegestudent
104.review: I decided to go with a MacBook Pro when my $1300 HP spectre overheated and the motherboard was burnt. I have always heard great things about the Macs in terms of reliability, so I thought that I could get over my PC preference just for the sake of having something that would last 5+ years. It came (brand new, not open box) with a broken microphone and one of the Micro USB ports only works sometimes. Apple is supposed to be fixing it for free since its under warranty, but I’ve been waiting until the end of the semester to send it in.
104.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

105.author: Isaac
105.review: First of all I'm a Big Mac Avid user and fan. But these supposed entry level macs are amazing. I require a lot of computing power and reliability, with Mainstage/Logic, Kontact, & ableton being some of the major programs I use simultaneously. Technically, you're supposed to have a much more upgraded Mac to run these programs along with all the patches. But, this MacBook Pro does just fine!!! Another words I'm doing the same thing with this entry-level MacBook Pro and saving thousands of dollars!!! Additionally, the new space gray it's like the best color for a Mac pro
105.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

106.author: TedS418
106.review: This Apple MacBook Pro is fast and has great screen resolution.I opted for the smaller size screen as it's lighter for carrying(especially biz travel) - don't need a bigger screen, and when I'm plugged in at work I simply connect to a full size desk monitor (which gives me two displays to work with). Not thrilled with Apple's decision to minimize ports - that limits flexibility IMO, and it's a pain to pay more to add peripherals needed for office work. That's the only reason it doesn't get 5 stars from me. Other than that, I'm very happy with the product's performance.
106.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

107.author: Cheyrenee
107.review: It took me a long time to actually commit to the purchase of my new MacBook. I’ve always used HP and never had issues but the life of the computer wasn’t the greatest. Since I’ve had an iPhone for the last 6 years I decided I would get a MacBook. Great investment!!! I would recommend to all. It’s easy to use. The picture quality is outstanding. Great for Netflix binge. Long battery life! I did learn a command that will turn off all the opens you open which really saves the battery. Command Q.
107.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

108.author: Ksunshine223
108.review: I’ve had just about every apple product there is since apple came out, however, this is my first apple macbook. I love it! Definitely better then a windows laptop and i do photography so its great, however a MacBook is completely different then any apple product I’ve ever had. It’s taking a lot to get use to and i’m Still learning. I do wish some things were a little easier with photos but i’m Sure once i learn it more it’ll get better
108.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

109.author: Kimberley
109.review: Because my MacBook Pro from 2012 was no longer able to keep up with the new software updates, I needed to upgrade to a new laptop. I was able to use my student discount and got it for a great price. The only downside is that I don't love the new keyboard design and the change of the outlets on the sides. There is no longer the universal USB ports as well as the CD/DVD insertion area. I didn't realize until I got home that I needed to buy an additional adapter to connect any USBs into my laptop.
109.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

110.author: oklanole
110.review: This is my second MacBook Pro. The first one was a 2010 15' MacBook Pro. I loved that Mac, but is was beginning to show its age. This new one is so quick. I have seen tons of stuff about the keyboard, but a week in and I have not had any problems adjusting to it. The keys do not travel far when you push them but I like it. Keep in mind that I am not banging out 110 wpm. The HD (solid state) is only 256 GB but with cloud storage I do not see that as an issue. I would happily buy again. Plus the $200 off sale BB was having made it a no brainer.
110.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

111.author: Manish
111.review: I bought this laptop after returning my other Windows laptop. On paper, configuration looks lower than other Windows laptops available in market but when it comes to the speed there is no comparison. 128GB hard disk space is little less but you can easily expand it by buying an external hard disk for much cheaper price than upgrading to 256GB model. It's small, sleek and stylish and doesn't feel heavy on ur lap even after long hours of usage. Although display is small but watching a movie is still a pleasure on Retina display.
111.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

112.author: Draperfish
112.review: I love this new MacBook Pro, I traded in my 2009 MacBook Pro 13", it was still working fine after almost 10 years but it had become too slow and I wanted to upgrade to a newer machine. I've had very good experiences with MacBooks, my daughter is still using a 2011 Pro daily for school and it still runs great (has SSD hard drive). The 2017 model is a lot thinner, lighter, and faster. I expect to get many years of use out of this one too. The fit and finish is outstanding, it just feels and looks like a quality machine.
112.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

113.author: CazualGaymer
113.review: This MacBook Pro is great for someone that is new to apple but It doesn’t have enough internal space for a lot of large files or apps. After powering it on and allowing it to update, installing office apps and a few other things I had just under 70GB. I decided to return it and pickup the 256GB instead. If you just need a basic MacBook Pro and are not storing large files the 128 GB great. If you are more seasoned or need to store larger files or install more apps I recommend going with the 256GB instead.
113.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

114.author: samuel92
114.review: Very nice laptop but I feel there are a couple of things I need to say. The battery life on this is shorter than my last macbook pro 2015 version also I feel that the eggheads that make the macbooks should have included a usb adapter, since the technology has obviously not caught up yet. These macbooks are not cheap so its only common sense to provide something as important as a usb adapter especially if they are being produced in china and making them dirt cheap. Apple needs to get with the program. nobody want to buy an adapter for 20$
114.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

115.author: Cscoon
115.review: It was a very easy set up. No problem getting my email account set up. I love the size and ability to carry it in my leather bag. I have installed several programs on it with no problems. I was hoping the screen size would not be too small, as I was using a much larger screen on my last MacBook Pro. I love the smaller screen, actually better than the large one. It was a great purchase, including the price. Happy customer.
115.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

116.author: Mariah
116.review: I love the new MacBook I've never had one before but I love the space grey color and works perfect fun laptop it's a little hard getting used to the trackpad but I was between a dell and apple but apple has more apps to play around with you won't go wrong with buying one but you need to buy the adapter for USB and all the other stuff for cds or head phone jack but the blue tooth settings work great ..
116.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

117.author: mid20something
117.review_title: Excellent - As Every Apple Product I've Owned
117.review: I had to buy this computer after my 2011 macbook pro bit the dust. Since it had lasted 7 years with no issues I knew I had to stick with this brand, plus I love the apple systems. It downloaded all of my icloud information seemlessly and I hardly missed a beat with schoolwork and such. I bought this computer in Grove City, Ohio because I was home at the time, and their apple team took great care of me at that Best Buy. 10/10 would recommend
117.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

118.author: Jihi2000
118.review: My daughter is required to use her laptop for schoolwork daily; therefore, I no longer could share my computer with her. I needed dependability and a product that could accommodate her learning needs over the next four years; thus, I elected to purchase this quality product. She is eager to take notes, submit work on-line, complete audio/video projects, and is thriving academically. Great investment!
118.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

119.author: ykim05
119.review: Apple has come out with another great product. The sleek, lightweight design and user-friendliness are a given. I always love how well other Apple products work well with each other, and I knew it was time to buy another Apple MacBook when my 7-year-old previous MacBook was struggling with the newer updates. I still love the longevity regarding overall usage and battery life. I am very satisfied with my purchase!
119.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

120.author: Converter
120.review: I love my new laptop! I'm so happy with all the features! I opted out of the touch bar for financial reasons but I haven't honestly thought about it until writing this. The computer is super fast and I love how easy it is the work on. I was a little hesitant when I was looking at the keyboard differences compared to older models but don't be afraid! This keyboard is awesome and worth it!
120.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

121.author: TheHeelyGod
121.review_title: Perfect, easy to use and reliable
121.review: As a graphic designer, photographer and vocalist this laptop handles all the programs I use very well. The MacBook Pro is a beast under heavy rendering and performs smoothly. I get about a full day use when I’m not running power consuming applications such as Photoshop and Ableton Live. The force touch track pad and keyboard and Retina display add a very aesthetic vibe to the laptop itself. This is a very premium ultra book and it doesn’t feel cheap whatsoever. I’m very impressed with it and I can’t wait to see what the future holds.
121.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

122.author: LuckyCowboy
122.review_title: Excellent Laptop for the College Student
122.review:
The Pros
Blazing overall performance; Fastest SSD ever in a laptop; Quieter (and more durable) keyboard; Hey Siri' support built in; Great Retina Display gets True Tone ; Awesome speakers

The Cons
Graphics performance falls behind competition; Battery life could be better; No full-size USB or SD Card slot; Expensive

Verdict
The 2018 MacBook Pro 13-inch is super fast and the keyboard is improved, but the battery life could be better.
122.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

123.author: LuckyCowboy
123.review_title: Excellent Mac Laptop for the College Student
123.review:
The Pros
Blazing overall performance; Fastest SSD ever in a laptop; Quieter (and more durable) keyboard; Hey Siri' support built in; Great Retina Display gets True Tone ; Awesome speakers

The Cons
Graphics performance falls behind competition; Battery life could be better; No full-size USB or SD Card slot; Expensive

Verdict
The 2018 MacBook Pro 13-inch is super fast and the keyboard is improved, but the battery life could be better.
123.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

124.review_title: Great laptop for a college kid
124.review: I purchased this laptop for my son who will be starting college in a few months and after looking at other laptops - Apple pro seemed to be a better choice - stronger , more durable , no virus , no updates all the built in apps are great . Compatible with his I phone and Apple ear buds , just an all around great buy! Caught it on sale so I paid under $1000.00 which to me is worth it considering I shouldn't have to buy him a new computer while he's still in school!
124.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

125.author: Aubs
125.review: I got this new MacBook because my air was outdated and didn’t want to risk it crashing on me when I started law school. I am happy to say this laptop is my life. The Retina display is unreal and I love the way it displays my documents. I also enjoy all the additional features it comes with. More importantly, the charcoal color is super elegant. Too bad I have a small scratch on the front. The only downside is I had to get one of my keyboard keys fixed because the new keyboard is sensitive.
125.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

126.author: Katie
126.review: This laptop is absolutely amazing! If your on the fence about purchasing it, treat your self. If you have many other Apple products, like my self, iPhone, Apple Watch, Apple TV, it’s time you get the MacBook. The pro is everything I’ve ever needed in a laptop! It’s compatability with my other products is amazing! If I forget my phone at home, that’s fine I don’t need it as long as my computers on WiFi! Calls, FaceTime, texts and iMessage. It does it all. Treat your self to a MacBook! You won’t regret it!
126.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

127.author: KittenKaboodle
127.review: I bought this as an upgrade to my 2012 MBA that was also 128GB. Initially, I figured this would be enough storage, but ultimately returned it for the Pro 256GB. I'm guessing the performance is exactly the same, but I do feel 128GB will be too small for me at some point as I add more web development applications. For normal use (browser, word processing, etc.) this should be enough.
127.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

128.author: BlurayAddict1
128.review: Even though I've only had it a couple of days I can honestly say unless something goes wrong this laptop is amazing. From the Mac OS to all its features I am still learning it is top notch. No need to go to Genius Bar for class just look on youtube and you can find anything. The SSD hard drive to intel i5 7th generation chip to battery life makes this laptop a 5 star review. Sure nothings perfect and you can write a negative review on any product out there but this is about close to perfect as you can get.
128.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

129.author: SRH11
129.review: I originally bought the 12'' MacBook but after playing with it for a little bit I realized it was a little too small, plus with the 'm' processor, I was at risk of being left behind on future software upgrades so I decided to shell out $200 more for this pro version. Best choice ever, now I have a new generation i5 processor and bigger screen. Probably the only complaint I have is getting used to the new style keyboard and the lack of any USB ports however It's not a deal breaker. Awesome Apple build and design, highly recommend!
129.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

130.author: GearJammer1967
130.review: I'll keep it simple, for an average person who surfs the web, pays bills online, shops on Amazon or Best Buy, streams on Netflix or Amazon Prime and numerous other basic tasks in everyday life. This is the perfect computer and in my opinion the best computer money can buy. Now if you want more bang for your buck then buy the 15 in pro with all of the bells and whistles. Either way you can't go wrong with a Mac.
130.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

131.author: RetiredBoomer
131.review: Purchased for a granddaughter who is off to college. Ideal for portability, reliability and adequate performance and memory. The screen is excellent and the sound is surprisingly vey good for a 13" laptop sized unit. I purchased a universal port adapter to provide the needed USB and other connections. Engineering students might consider whether engineering specific applications that they may use are available for Apple operating system.
131.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

132.author: Anonymous
132.review: I had a Macbook Pro 2015 before buying this new laptop. It's basically what I expected - a new Macbook pro with marginally better specs. As with all Macbooks, the functionality is a bit more limited than that of Windows computers, but a Macbook is very good at what it does. Good laptop for someone who doesn't need to do that much on a computer other than use Microsoft Suite, Netflix, and the occasional low-spec game.
132.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

133.author: Tree
133.review_title: Love it, but the older models were better
133.review: Honestly, Apple is supposed to be the leading company in tech, but I feel like this laptop lacks what many would consider to be basic requirements. Where is the hard drive and why can I only store documents in the cloud? The computer works, and everything runs perfectly. But I bought this for school after spilling hot tea on my old mac, and I wish I could turn back time. My old mac did everything this one does, and had a disc drive and a hard drive and it was cheaper. I'll leave it there.
133.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

134.author: peach
134.review: I recently purchased this for college and I am really pleased with it! The Macbook Pro works smoothly without too many problems and lag. I like that it turns on within seconds. The only flaws I have with this Macbook is that it heats up pretty quickly and takes a bit of time to cool down. It runs out of battery within a few hours but it takes less than an hour to charge it back to 100%. Overall, I am very pleased with the product.
134.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

135.author: Lisa
135.review: I decided to upgrade from the MacBook Air to the Pro this summer and I am absolutely satisfied with this product. I am a full time college student, so I am in constant need of a computer when it comes to getting my school work done, in addition to taking notes in class. If you are familiar with other Apple products, the Pro is very easy to use and navigate, and it comes with a decent battery life as well. I highly recommend the MacBook Pro to college students, as it is worth every penny! :)
135.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

136.author: techlover
136.review: Upgraded my 2012 Macbook Pro to this model. You can tell the difference right away when you open the box. It's thinner and better looking than my 2012 Macbook and after using it for 2 weeks, I can say that the performance of this laptop is definitely an improvement and works better than my PC laptop that I bought 6 months ago. I think if you're looking for a new laptop or for an upgrade, this laptop should definitely be considered.
136.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

137.author: Pete
137.review: It’s an Apple product, so you know it’s good quality and easy to use. They are also pricey, but that’s where Best Buy comes in clutch with the great prices!!! I’ve owned a second gen MacBook Pro since it came out and love it!! The only reason I purchased this one is because my little ones literally smashed the other one to death!! Highly recommend if you have the funds for it, definitely won’t be disappointed!!
137.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

138.author: Aerials
138.review: I decided to upgrade from my late 2015 MacBook Pro. The form factor is much slimmer and compact that the 2015 model. In terms of processing and speed it seems about the same. I just use it for the typical word/excel processing, internet browsing, Netflix, YouTube, etc and it does the job really well. There’s no lag at all. Overall glad I made this purchase.
138.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

139.author: Esmereli
139.review: This is a reliable and easy computer to use. Apple computers rarely get viruses so the need for an antivirus software is not needed, which is great! It’s light weight. The space grey is astheticaly pleasing color. I love that it’s easy to navigate and I can sync my phone to my computer. The only downfall is that it lacks usb- lightning, hdmi, and sd ports. It only comes with 2 usb-c port and the earbud jack. That is my only disregard but other than that love this computer!
139.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

140.author: morgan0395
140.review:
Was looking for a mobile solution for graphic design, photo editing, and software developing. This was it. 

The only downside is the lack of SSD space. The upgraded SSD is $200 more for only 128gb more space. It kind of sucks since you can get an M.2 that's faster for much less than that with much more storage space.

I'd give it 5 stars if storage wasn't so costly. Otherwise, it fits all of our needs.
140.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

141.author: Johnny
141.review: If you’ve had a macbook pro before, than you know what to expect with apple products which includes features like no audio jack (gasp) & no cd/dvd drive (as I believe QE’s Tan said something like why arent you streaming?!?). So 3 stars because aint nothing new nor exciting bout it, but at least I’ll get a good cpl of yrs out of it where my last one was around 6 yrs old before I spilled liquid on it & it stopped working
141.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

142.author: MrsG
142.review: I absolutely love my MacBook Pro! I recently upgraded from my old one and can’t get enough of it. As a busy mom & small business owner I need to be able to work on the go! This allows me to do that with a lot less weight! Though it’s a little heavier than the regular MacBook & Macbook Air I couldn’t pass up the quality of the Pro and so grateful I stuck with the one I wanted. This has already been put to great use and will be used for years to come!!
142.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

143.author: cara
143.review: This thing is amazing!!! Bought it as an open box and it is still perfect!! Turns on lightning fast, screen brightness, resolution and volume are top notch. No complaints at all. Purchased AppleCare with it on sale so that was a plus. You should be aware that there is no USB port, that is an accessory you need to purchase separately. Customer service was very capable and pleasant to deal with. I will definitely purchase another Apple product in the future.
143.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

144.author: DrFeeeeleeeygood
144.review: The new MacBook Pros are sleek and as powerful as ever. I love this laptop and have not had a problem to date. The touchpad is great and has me questioning myself if I even need to spend the money for a mouse. The Retina display is also another addition to mention. The screen provides a great experience visually. Colors are just more colorful and the clarity seems very defined. I know Im repeating what a lot of people say, but this laptop is definitely worth the money. So many pluses.
144.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

145.author: mikeP
145.review: My previous MacBook Pro was 8 years old and although it still works perfectly, I really wanted a new one. The timing was perfect to buy the new MacBook Pro and hand my old one off to my 16 year old daughter. I didn't realize how much they changed!! The new keyboard is amazing, I now do not like typing on my 8 year old iMac at all!!! (New iMac is next!). How thin and light this computer is blows my mind as well!! Couldn't be happier!!!
145.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

146.author: JWS1510
146.review: What can I say? There's a reason people spend the extra money for Apple products - Quality! I unfortunately use a Surface Pro for work and have nothing but issues with it. The Apple laptop is expensive but I also believe you get what you pay for. I compare it to purchasing a Toyota versus a Kia. Sure the Kia is less expensive and loaded with features, but I'll bet you'll still see that Toyota driving down the road as the Kia is being loaded onto a flat bed for transport to the salvage yard.
146.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

147.author: Wade
147.review: I had no idea that OS was any different than IOS. It looks like Apple would have made the iPhone and the apple MacBook more compatible. This computer six. I can not do anything on it that I need to do. I run a business, but you can’t with this computer along with your iPhone. Looks like employees at Best Buy would have told me how incompatible those two were. Sad. I bought a 2000 dollar computer that Best Buy will not take back.
147.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

148.author: Genetti17
148.review: I have been using this for over a month and love it. It's relatively light and compact and the screen is is very bright, a huge improvement over the MacBook Air that I replaced with this one. Its about the same size and weight but much more powerful. The battery life seems much improved as well. The keyboard is a little different then previous MacBooks but after a short time you get use to it. looking into a 4K monitor to use with this as well and will post an update once i have chosen one.
148.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

149.author: MMatt
149.review: This machine lives up to the hype, it's great. Battery life is excellent, screen is beautiful, keyboard is oddly appealing, but there the "issues" we all know about. The lack of ports and an SD card reader, frankly sucks. I had to give in and buy a dongle the same day I purchased the machine. The plus side is that the machine looks sleek without all the holes on the sides and the USB-C charging is rather nice. I am overall happy with the replacement of my old friend (mid 2010 MBP).
149.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

150.author: shord
150.review: Yes, I am an Apple Fanboy, so I love the apple platform. If you are a hater, go on to next review. If you are not sure, here are some things to look at. Solid keyboard. Great Display. Apple quality. Yes, it is pricier than a Windows PC, but I always say you get what you pay for. I have several Windows 10 PC's from work. Nice, but nothing compares to the fluid movement from Mac, to iPad, to iPhone. Just not the same with any other platform.
150.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

151.author: jmajik
151.review: I like this laptop because it is small but powerful. I can easily work on my Microsoft Office applications and do my work and school work. I take it with me everywhere I travel because connected to WiFi is so easy and convenient. I must admit that I am a little disappointed that I can't plug and play my Go Pro 6 and get the videos from my travels to even load up.
151.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

152.author: Birdman
152.review: Purchasing a MacBook Pro is such a great investment! Not only are you getting a very solid piece of technology, but the user experience is like none other. You’ll never want to wait for a Windows laptop to power up again after you’ve turned on a MacBook Pro. Everytime a new operating system is released all you have to do is download and install, no need to purchase so you’re always up to date, keep that in mind with the purchse price you won’t get that on a Windows laptop.
152.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

153.author: gdcohan
153.review_title: Portable, performant computer at reasonable price
153.review: I was looking for a second laptop to do work from while I was at home, take traveling, etc. I tried both the older and newer macbook airs and found that neither was quite up to the tasks I had. The cheapest macbook pro turned out to be the perfect fit, though definitely a little pricier. Other down sides are a little bit lackluster battery life (probably due to its retina screen that I don't really care about) and the fact that it's considerably more expensive to get over 128gb of memory.
153.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

154.author: DigitalTechReviewer
154.review: I've had my MacBook Pro 13' with Retina display for about a month now. I couldn't be more please with it's performance. Prior to owning a MacBook Pro, I owned Hp computers and all of them would crash. So, as you would imagine it was very frustrating. Working in Television everyone I know owns Apple products so I guess it was only a matter of time that I too would own at least one Apple product. I'm never going back to PC's again!
154.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

155.author: bigblackhole
155.review: I was doing a lot of research and I wasn't sure if I should get a mac or a dell xps, and the end what made me choose the mac were the speakers quality, screen color gamut and the location of the webcam compared to the xps. I got this base model because I think the other models are overpriced due to the touch bar which I think is useless. This works great as a daily computer and I can browse and watch 4k videos without any issues. I definitely love this computer.
155.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

156.author: Marx
156.review: Apple excersises their use of their technology being simple for the customers who buy them. The MacBook I purchased is easy to set up and use with a clean sleek look and design. Apple never fails to amaze me with their level of cleanliness and good looking products. Although I do rate this 4 and not a 5 because there is no USB ports. The ports on the computer are type-c and only work with type-c wires which are an additional purchase.
156.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

157.author: ShawnyC
157.review: Coming from a windows laptop that had some issues, this MacBook is a big step up. It is very fast when doing anything I really need it to do. Battery life far exceeded my expectations as I don't really ever feel pressured to charge it in times when I don't want to. The screen is great as well. The only thing is adjusting to the Apple ecosystem, but once I get more adjusted the laptop will only get better for me.
157.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

158.author: JessB
158.review:
This computer is awesome. I upgraded from a 15" 2011 macbook pro, and this exceeds my expectations in every day. Despite the smaller screen size, I hardly miss the 15" due to its weight. At only 5'2 it was a lot to lug around!
This model is much more lightweight, i can tuck my laptop case in my big bag and I'm out the door no problem.
It's also great on battery life, I feel like I never have to charge it despite using it for everything from general emails to WOW.
158.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

159.author: Byrd
159.review: I've had several different MacBook Pro's while in college and they all have worked flawlessly! Great operating system, great graphics, and above all VERY USER FRIENDLY. The only drawback to this model for me is it doesn't have a USB port; howerer, there is andaptor. Honestly it's never really been too big of a hassle the majority of my stuff is sent through email or there are other means to get it that are simple. Overall a great product and I would say it's totally worth the money!
159.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

160.author: JoJoBear
160.review: Traded in my 2011 MacBook Air for a new MacBook Pro and wow! The display and colors are so vivid, faster, and doesn’t weigh much at all. Only downfall is the headphone port is for the older style headphones (3.5mm headphones) and it doesn’t have a plugin for the lightning connector headphones. It wasn’t a big deal but just a heads up. Oh and there’s no USB port, only 2 USB-C. I had to purchase a USB-C to USB adapter to use my flash drives and such.
160.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

161.author: tbelcher
161.review: I absolutely love my MacBook Pro. I could just be bias to apple products, but I truly believe they create the best technology. The Pro runs at superior speeds, the screen resolution is fantastic, and its always a plus that when my phone isn't around, I can receive iMessages while I am on the laptop. If you want a reliable, dependable, fast, and just all amazing laptop, this is the one to get. While the prices are high, the MacBook is definitely worth the money.
161.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

162.author: BoBS
162.review: I love the size and weigh of the MacBook. I bought an open book. The machine is fast and the screen is really crisp and clear. The only problem is the operating system. It is a huge learning curve. After using windows since I've been working on computers. Apple is a whole new ball game. The good news is whenever I have a problem I call Apple Support and they are great. I'm glad the B.B. salesman talked me into a MacBook.........
162.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

163.author: friendofcarlotta
163.review: Yeah, I know that Apple hasn't truly updated the MacBook Pro is years and the new ones have virtually zero ports, but my old one (the one with all the great ports and a CD drive) was getting a little slow, wouldn't unlock with Apple Watch, and wasn't capable of running Mojave. When I saw that Best Buy was discounting them a couple hundred bucks, I made the move. This new one is faster, and I like the keyboard.
163.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

164.author: Miranda
164.review: A few years ago I had a 17" MacBook Pro and loved it. I figured it was time for an upgrade when I was accepted into a new program at University. I'm very pleased with the design of the product, the click of the keys (though it did take some getting used to), and the size of the trackpad. I'm a huge Apple fan and love my new MacBook Pro. I'm sure it will do me proud just like all of my other Apple products.
164.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

165.author: Camgirl
165.review: Ok so i was so excited to buy my 1st mac book without fully doing research and once i bought it and it was time to upload pics there wants any side outlets for my USB!! so i had to buy an add on for it which was like $100 also you can only use the OLD headphones to plug in! just make sure this computer is really what you want & HAVE before splurging!
165.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

166.author: kidsouljah
166.review:
This is my first Apple computer/laptop and I really like it. It works great for what I do with it. I browse and watch videos mostly. The picture is great and the size is excellent. I am very happy with product. Wish it was touchscreen!
That being said battery life could be better and keep in mind it that it only has 2 usb-c ports and a headphone jack.
166.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

167.author: LWagner
167.review: I love the apple products, traded in an older MacBook pro and an iPad for this new MacBook. Also received the student discount so it was an excellent deal. One drawback , I did not realize it does not have a USB port (had to go back to buy an adapter) and I miss the 'magnetic' connector when you plug in the charger. Otherwise it's fast, lightweight and overall an excellent purchase .
167.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

168.author: Bibbo
168.review: This is a great computer and really enjoying it. Still learning how to get all the uses that it has to offer. I'm not a computer whiz and use mine for basic needs only. For those who are computer savvy this is a great computer! My last computer which was not an apple and i was compromised by hackers. My daughter recommended the Max Pro which was a lot harder for hackers to get into.
168.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

169.author: Btyler
169.review: This is an amazing laptop. I was skeptical of getting this because Apple was upgrading their MacBook pros to the 8th gen Intel processors with 4 cores and this one only has the dual-core I5, the dual-core processor runs like a champ. Apple's optimization of their products is outstanding and it shows that they really maximize their products with the hardware. Great Job!
169.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

170.author: Wizzer
170.review: I got one for my daughter for college and she uses it for mostly office applications and email. More than enough power, a lot faster than her MacBook Air. Definitely sturdier. Form factor is actually smaller than her previous MacBook Air and battery life is just as good. She commented the other day that it seems like it is lighter than her Air as well.
170.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

171.author: Hopetrex
171.review: This is my first Macbook after having a Toshiba laptop for many years. I have an I-phone so the learning curve isn't too bad but I'm still unsure if I am completely happy with the purchase. I wish I would have purchased a 15 inch screen but not sure if that feature is worth the extra money. I am happy with it being lightweight, the slim design, battery life and display. The rest I will wait and see.
171.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

172.author: Matt28788
172.review: I have had a good time with this laptop, it's fast, it's small, and very light. It has an amazing display but I have had a couple of screen glitches. The whole bar at the top of the screen where the time and battery are, just disappeared. It was there but it had nothing on it. Also when I first turn on the laptop, sometimes it freaks out and displays a whole bunch of color for a split second.
172.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

173.author: RonA
173.review:
This is my first mac book and I am very satisfied. The performance is excellent. Fast processor compared to my windows. It took me a while to get use to the shortcut commands being used to windows but it's not an issue at all. 
I was able to avail of the price adjustment without a fuss when Best Buy had an Apple promo and that makes it even perfect.
173.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

174.author: kk15
174.review: Upgrading from a 2013 MacBook Pro, this is a great change! the retina screen is so bright, it doesn't get super hot when I use it, and when I use it for hours a day it only needs to be charged twice a week max! The butterfly keys are very different but I like them because your fingers can glide and type a lot more quicker. You just have to get used to the noise when typing.
174.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

175.author: Araceli
175.review: This laptop is amazing ... it is very hard to get a virus on your Mac. Very simple and easy to use. Comes with so many free apps to use for example iMovies ! Awesome application to use if you are a beginner on editing videos! No need to purchase any other application atleast to start off with. Storage space is amazing! Everything is well organized. The laptop is overall pretty fast. If you need a laptop that you want to rely on for years then this is a go to
175.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

176.author: ak24
176.review_title: Converted a Windows fan with this one.
176.review: I wasn't big on Apple. After my last laptop stopped working, I took the plunge with an Apple product. My experience with the Iphone SE had made me hesitant but after using this Macbook, I really like it. I'm unsure if I like it so much because I moved up from my old $400 laptop to a $1200 laptop, or is it because i moved up to a Macbook. But either way, so far I'm liking what i have. Taking a bit of time to get used to the IOS, but it works fine.
176.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

177.author: tfrye
177.review: I love using my MacBook Pro after having the air. The battery life is significantly better and I like using the new style of keys. I am still learning all the functions, but am excited to start editing pictures. I had a great experience with the staff- both the sales team and the geek squad team were patient and caring in helping me with my decision and transferring data. Thank you!
177.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

178.author: OnlineShopper
178.review: This replaced my 2010 MacBook. I was no longer able to update the software and although it still met my needs I wasn’t able to creat a presentation for work. I decided to go with the 13” instead of the 15” that I had. Much lighter, longer battery life and really not much changed from my previous one. I love apple products and will not change.
178.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

179.author: Ebmac
179.review: The computer functions great but as a photographer I find it incredibly frustrating that Apple decided to change its ports. Every time I have to use a regular USB connection or an sd card I need an external plug in. It makes using the computer a hassle. But as always the screen and overall quality is great, as an average user only using it for basic word processing or internet it might not get in the way too much.
179.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

180.author: Sparky
180.review: I searched and researched everything out there. After continuing to go through laptops and hard drives I went with Apple. My iMac has lasted 8 years without issues, so just natural that now that I need a portable computer I selected MacBook Pro. Unbelievable! Smooth Design. Long Battery. Workhorse. Everything I have thrown at it, works without issue. Highly Recommend. Bought for myself, but wife can’t keep hands off of it!!
180.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

181.author: Ernie
181.review: If you are looking for a good laptop for school or for anything you wish to use it for this is the laptop. Easy to take anywhere not that heavy could use to watch movies in your bed don't need that much space for it. If you are an apple fan and you have any apple technologies easy to sync to it. The only thing I would regret is probably getting a bigger screen other than that everything is perfect.
181.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

182.author: Courtney
182.review: I haven't had a new Macbook in ten years and I am so excited to have one again! I love all of Apple's products. This laptop is lightweight and fast, only issue I'm finding is that it's not holding many photos. I am a photographer and I shoot in RAW meaning my images are HUGE files. So I will be needing an external hard drive very soon. Other than that, I love this computer!
182.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

183.author: Mary
183.review: This is a five star computer--the feel, the computing speed, the weight--all are wonderful and meet/exceed expectations. The four star rating is because of the need for external storage due to limited size of hard drive and for attachments to access even the hard drive. Shame on Apple for pulling this stunt; praise to Apple for support and help they have provided many times.
183.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

184.author: jmacs
184.review: Macbook Pro is indeed a pro! The elegant laptop design, stunning retina display, over time reliability, processing power, battery life, thin and super lightweight plus a strong recommendation from a friend…all of these combined together made me decide buying a Macbook Pro and I am extremely happy with my purchase. It definitely meets my every day computing needs. I definitely and highly recommend this great product.
184.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

185.author: Bobobowers
185.review: I ABSOLUTELY love this laptop! I have the absolute base model for this MacBook Pro, and the only complaint that I have would be that I am almost out of storage as I have the 121 gb flash storage. I feel like this computer packs a MASSIVE punch in performance despite being the base model for this laptop. Apple gives its consumers a type of amazing status with their products. I feel like I am envied, and like I have class with this device!
185.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

186.author: Heather
186.review: I love my Macbook Pro. This is my first Mac and I went into Best Buy prepared to get a Macbook Air, but I couldn’t resist the newest Pro model. It’s gorgeous, lightweight and does everything I need it to. The battery lasts forever and the picture is crystal clear. I don’t do anything super complex on it, I do billing, write papers and do leisurely activities like watch Netflix. Great for anyone looking for a computer to do the basic things!
186.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

187.author: GradStudent
187.review_title: It is a great laptop!~ with minor glitches
187.review: This laptop is amazing, it really does everything I need for my graduate program and more! There are two minor glitches, when I first turn it on it has a fuzzy gray screen and another issue is the sound goes out sometimes and I need to restart my computer to fix it! Those do not occur every time though and may just be my particular computer!
187.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

188.author: JHouse
188.review: I've ordered around 20 of these for my work. The only problem I have had was one came with a faulty battery, but BB exchanged it out so it was only the slight annoyance of driving back. Great little machine, and the only drawback is the lack of legacy ports. If they only included a HDMI and older USB it would be great. But they didn't. Hence the star off. I just hate carrying around dongles lol.
188.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

189.author: RyZone
189.review: This is by far the worst laptop i’ve Ever purchased honestly a $300 dell would probably work better than this laptop. The wireless receiver sucks and you can barely get WiFi anywhere. My phone gets signal in places that my laptop can’t. Has a nice screen and battery life everything else feels is like using a 10year old computer. When I try to edit videos it’s horrible can’t handle 4K footage.
189.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

190.author: Richard93
190.review: Everyone already knows how great MacBooks are I just wanted to restate that. It is absolutely beautiful. Obviously for the price you can get a laptop with much greater specs but it won't be as smooth and nice looking as a MacBook. And tbh the specs are enough for a student in college. Btw the price I payed for was only about $1025 and that was included taxes. I was luckily able to use the student discount and there was a flash sale. Great deal !
190.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

191.author: Smith
191.review: This is my first Apple computer and I am so in love, already. Still learning all of the nifty secrets and shortcuts but I’m beyond satisfied. I did expect at least one USB port to be included in the computer. But I suppose I overlooked that detail before purchasing. Just not looking forward to buying an additional piece to carry around.
191.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

192.author: Putty
192.review: Best purchase I’ve made in a long time! My son told me that I should try the MacBook Pro since I had originally been using a regular laptop. I’m not that tech savvy. I can’t believe how easy it is to use. It’s super fast and powerful with a clear screen. Holds a charge for a long time and charges up super fast when needed. Lightweight and portable.
192.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

193.author: aragon415
193.review:
This laptop was just what I wanted. Fast processor and an easy way to get to know the features in a simplistic way. I would recommend this to any college student who is looking for a new laptop to get it.
The only con that I have about this laptop is that the internet has crashed on me more than once. I would recommend probably downloading an internet browser other than safari (i.e. Google Chrome), to have a crash-free surfing the web experience.
193.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

194.author: Tatershells
194.review:
Have been going back and forth between MacBook pro and An HP for a couple months with every aspect of specs price and quality. 
Finally decided on the MacBook Pro due to the fact our household loves Apple products. 
This laptop is quick professional easy to learn and use? Everything about it is what was was in reviews and info. I am very pleased with it. Especially coming from an HP this laptop is seriously fast!
194.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

195.author: Consumerism
195.review: Bought this for the wifey for her school projects. This laptop is thin, light, quiet and sexy. The only negative is that it has minimal usbc inputs which means you will need an adaptor or dongles if you want to connect non usbc peripherals so plan on another 50-100$ for that. If you don’t need all the extra dongles then this thing will work great for you.
195.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

196.author: Ehoffer16
196.review: I'm not thrilled that you have to have an attachment to use USB ports, memory cards, CDs/DVDs or anything else useful. They've switched to a type c port so you have to buy (go figure) an adapter if you want to plug anything else into it. However, it's still wonderful and still the best option even with the inconvenience of adapters.
196.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

197.author: consultrj
197.review: We bought this product for our daughter who is about to enter HS. She was insistent on a Mac, but we wanted to learn more about it before making our decision. With the support and advice of one of the Best Buy associates, we selected the MacBook Pro. Though she hasn't used it yet for school, it appears to have the capability of meeting her needs. Of course, she's in love with it.
197.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

198.author: Lrosario1
198.review: I’ve always been a PC guy but recently made the jump to the Mac and I don’t regret it. Yes the computer only has two ports and some have keyboard issues but for the most part this is an excellent computer. The backlight keyboard is fantastic. The body of the computer feels smooth and made of quality material. As for the performance it’s outstabd and makes other computers look horrible.
198.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

199.author: PeterPatel
199.review:
I purchase this computer for music and singing program, 
in new iTunes they remove Ibooks from iTunes Library, Apple want us to purchase more iCloud Storage. I spend $2000 and most wanted future is no more available. i am glade I have old 2012 MacBook Pro which I have Ibooks on iTunes library. I wish they fit this problem. I spend one hour with tech to find this out.
199.recommend: No, I would not recommend this to a friend

200.author: Chad
200.review: Bought this for my wife and her small business. It does exactly what it needs to do for her and was a decent price. There are more powerful laptops out there for less money but this macbook pro is worth the extra money for the confidence that it wont bog down or have future problems. We chose this model because we already have external storage and didnt want to buy the highest level for minor upgrades.
200.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

201.author: camarc
201.review:
My prior laptop was a 2013 MacBook Air. Decided to upgrade to a MacBrook pro. Biggest selling features for me (over my prior laptop) was the Retina display and increased RAM (8GB vs 4 GB). So far I'm happy with my purchase. 

Prior to buying the MacBook Pro I had read some negative reviews regarding the keyboard. I haven't had any problems adjusting to the "different" feel of the keyboard.
201.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

202.author: jbgood
202.review: Computer was purchased for my granddaughter, who is in the 9th grade (home schooling) and needs it for school. She plans to use it through college. We originally thought about getting a reconditioned model, because she needed a disk drive, but the school website is going to an online format, so the new model will work just fine. (We will be returning the reconditioned computer and expect to have no problems with that.)
202.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

203.author: Madisyn
203.review:
I absolutely love this MacBook. I love how it fits nicely in my book bag. I also love how it is thin and very easy to store and work on. The screen is really amazing quality. 

If you want a USB Drive, this does not come with it, but you can buy an adapter. That’s the only downside I looked at reviews but I didn’t pay attention to that part. So I’d totally reccomend this, as long as you are t looking for a USB drive.
203.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

204.author: amart181
204.review_title: Great laptop to have connected with iphone
204.review:
I didn’t have a MacBook before this one and I never knew how easy things have become with it being connected to my iPhone. I have all of my information, documents, pictures, messages, music, etc. easily on this MacBook because it’s under the same account as my phone. 

The speakers are insane, as well as the HD quality. What I love the most is the longevity of the battery life. I can go days without charging it.
204.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

205.author: Nicole
205.review: I have been debating on purchasing a MacBook for a few years now! Spending this type of money was crazy to me so i kept getting PC’s and the last one i had only lasted 4 months before it died i said that’s it let me just purchase a MacBook doing a lot of research and reading reviews This is best computer I’ve had i love it! Great battery life easy to use! Light weight slim! Not heavy at all!!! I love it
205.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

206.author: bmstaley
206.review: The customer services was spot on and even provided me with an option to buy a better computer at a discounted price which benefitted me greatly. The computer I was planning on buying wasn't as good as the one I did purchase. I would've never bought the one I did without their expertise help. I purchased a MacBook Pro instead of the MacBook Air and got a better product for the money.
206.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

207.author: JayJay
207.review: I think this laptob is great, i bought it for its effectiveness with home studio, work, and pleasure use. The only thing i was really disappointed with was the removal of all usb, hdmi, sd card slots by apple. I cant even connect my apple phone or headphones to the laptop, now i need to buy an adapter for every apple product. Was extremely upset when i seen this, since i was unaware. Other than that, its a great laptob
207.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

208.author: Sandy
208.review: My son convinced me to purchase an Apple years ago and it was the best decision I ever made! Awesome product. Have friends who purchased cheaper laptops that ended up returning them. When it was time for a new one, Apple was the only laptop I was interested in purchasing. Purchased the MacBook Pro and can't say enough positives about it. Highly recommend.
208.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

209.author: Jake
209.review: my brother just started college so I was looking for a reliable laptop for him. I already own a MacBook Air that I’ve had for years and i still love it , I’ve never had any problems with it so I knew I couldn’t go wrong with a Mac the only thing that may be a bit of an inconvenience is that it was no usb inputs so you would have to buy an external one
209.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

210.author: Gama151
210.review:
The school my daughter goes to has a office program that they can access on the cloud and because it's Apple friendly my daughter can access her schoolwork from home and get her reports done and saved online and then be able to print them off when she gets to school. 
As a cheerleader she can also help with creating flyers, videos and whatever else the coach needs her to do.
210.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend

211.author: Andrew
211.review_title: Easy to set up, has all the functions needed.
211.review: The MacBook Pro was easy and quick to set up, even though I had a number of downloads to complete before starting on the tasks I had in mind. I used common applications and software like gmail, Microsoft 365, and OneDrive. I only had to download the major software once under the primary user, and it was then available for all users.
211.recommend: I would recommend this to a friend
